title-group.article-title: The Effect of Location on the Performance of High Technology Firms

abstract.p: Many so called "high technology" firms have shown a tendency to agglomerate their facilities in particular areas such as Silicon Valley and the Boston area. In such areas there often exists a large supply of technically educated workers and an attractive physical and social environment suitable for attracting workers from other parts of the country. This study explores the importance of location to the financial performance of such firms using carefully selected samples of technologically-innovative firms from two high-tech regions and from a nationwide sample. Performance is assessed in terms of returns to equity shareholders. Risk attributes are also compared across sample components. Firm age and size are considered in the analysis. Results demonstrate an association between equity performance and location for high technology firms. Some of the location effect is indirect, impacting the beta and firm-specific risk of high-tech firms.
